articles.author: Alexander Cornwell, Parisa Hafezi, Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: Israel and Iran's air war entered a second week on Friday and European officials sought to draw Tehran back to the negotiating table after President Donald Trump said any decision on potential U.S. involvement would be made within two weeks.
articles.title: Israel-Iran air war enters second week as Europe pushes diplomacy

articles.author: Dietrich Knauth
articles.description: A U.S. appeals court let Donald Trump on Thursday retain control over California's National Guard while the state's Democratic governor proceeds with a lawsuit challenging the legality of the Republican president's use of the troops to quell protests and unrest in Los Angeles.
articles.title: US court lets Trump retain control of California National Guard for now

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Olivia Le Poidevin
articles.description: Children will begin to die of thirst, a spokesperson said.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill 44 Palestinians in Gaza, UN warns of drought

articles.author: David Brunnstrom, Doina Chiacu
articles.description: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres warned on Friday that expansion of the Israel-Iran conflict could "ignite a fire no one can control" and called on both sides and potential parties to the conflict to "give peace a chance."
articles.title: UN's Guterres urges 'give peace a chance' in Israel-Iran conflict

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: One person was killed and at least 14 were injured when Russian drones attacked the Ukrainian Black Sea city of Odesa overnight, damaging high-rise buildings and railway infrastructure, local authorities and prosecutors said on Friday.
articles.title: One killed, 14 injured in overnight Russian attack on Ukraine's Odesa

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump presided over a national security meeting about Iran with top aides at the White House on Friday, a U.S. official said.
articles.title: Trump presided over national security meeting on Iran, US official says

articles.author: Sarah Young, Andrew Macaskill
articles.description: Britain's parliament has paved the way for the country's biggest social change in a generation.
articles.title: UK parliament votes for assisted dying, paving way for historic law change

articles.author: Panarat Thepgumpanat, Panu Wongcha-Um
articles.description: Thailand's embattled Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra faced the prospect of losing her government's majority on Friday, as a vital coalition partner looked set to demand her resignation and senators launched a legal bid to remove her from office.
articles.title: Embattled Thai PM faces call to step down to avert coalition revolt

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin made the following comments at a plenary session of the St Petersburg International Economic Forum on Friday.
articles.title: Putin on Israel-Iran, Ukraine and the risk of the world sliding towards World War Three

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iraq's representative to the United Nations said 50 Israeli warplanes planes violated Iraqi airspace shortly before a U.N. meeting on the Israel-Iran conflict on Friday.
articles.title: Iraq says 50 Israeli warplanes planes violated its airspace
